meanings.definition: One who removes from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The deposer was responsible for taking the king out of his role.
meanings.sent2: The deposer led the movement to overthrow the corrupt government.
meanings.sent3: The deposer walked proudly after successfully dethroning the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent4: The deposer of the old regime was hailed as a hero by the people.
meanings.sent5: The deposer's actions changed the course of history forever.

meanings.definition: To remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The rebels planned to deposer the tyrant and restore peace.
meanings.sent2: The board decided to deposer the CEO due to misconduct.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to deposer the evil sorcerer from his throne.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight seemed to deposer the shadows in the room.
meanings.sent5: The judge had to deposer the corrupt official from his position.

meanings.definition: To put down or lay down something, especially in a formal or official manner.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer had to deposer the evidence before the court.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully deposer each brushstroke on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to deposer a dollop of cream on top of the dessert.
meanings.sent4: The architect planned to deposer the foundation of the new building tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to deposer their pencils on the desk before the test.
